name: Rectangular Micro-Pavé Diamond Tennis Bracelet
description: There’s nothing like capturing that ping of sparkle from diamond. Here’s that ping multiplied for an investment piece that’ll induce gasps for decades to come. Handcrafted in 14k solid gold featuring responsibly sourced diamonds. To put on the bracelet, insert the tongue into the clasp until you hear a "click." Then, clip the safety arms down on both sides of the clasp to secure the bracelet. To take it off, unclip and pull the two horizontal safety arms away from the sides of the clasp. Then, press the thin vertical button to release the inner tongue.

name: Evil Eye Beaded Pendant Necklace
description: The evil eye symbol belongs to and represents a multitude of cultural traditions. We acknowledge the importance of recognizing its history as a piece of jewelry that a global community holds close. With a deep appreciation for her Jordanian roots, Mejuri CEO and Founder Noura Sakkijha and our design team created an evil eye-inspired collection that invites everyone to wear this storied symbol of protection. It’s said to ward off envy and evil by bending it back on the bestower. Handcrafted in 18k gold vermeil.

name: Diamond Tennis Necklace 1.8mm
description: There’s nothing like capturing that ping of sparkle from diamond. Here’s that ping multiplied for an investment piece that’ll induce gasps for decades to come. Handcrafted in 14k solid gold featuring responsibly sourced diamonds. To put on the necklace, place the safety handles in your right hand and the inner tongue in your left, ensuring the diamond side faces out. Insert the tongue into the clasp until you hear a "click." Then, clip the safety arms down on both sides of the clasp to secure the necklace. To take it off, unclip and pull the two horizontal safety arms away from the sides of the clasp. Then, press the thin vertical button to release the inner tongue.

Plus, this versatile style was designed to be worn two ways—stack with pavé diamonds or flip it for a sleek 14k finish.
